description: Sum of totients of square divisors of n.
formula: a(n) = Sum[Phi[d]; d is square and divides n]Multiplicative with a(p^e) = (p^(e+1)+1)/(p+1) for even e and a(p^e) = (p^e+1)/(p+1) for odd e. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Dec 01 2001
example: n = 400: its square divisors are {1, 4, 16, 25, 100, 400}, their totients are {1, 2, 8, 20, 40, 160} and the totient-sum over these divisors is, so a(400) = 231. This value arises at special squarefree multiples of 400 (400 times 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 10, 11, 13, 15, 17, 19, 21, 22, 23 etc).a(400) = a(2^4*5^2) = (2^5+1)/3*(5^3+1)/6 = 231.
prog: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, eulerphi(d)*issquare(d)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 31 2013
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jun 19 2000
